resources.string: root
funkcion
combination with mental factors
EXAMPLE: with joy, adhering to the view that there is nothing wrong with stealing, a boy spontaneously steals an apple from a fruit shop.
EXAMPLE: With joy, holding the same view, he steals an apple, instigated by a friend.
EXAMPLE: the same situation as in examples 1 and 2, but at the same time the boy does not hold any wrong view.
EXAMPLE: the same situation as in examples 1 and 2, but at the same time the boy does not hold any wrong view.
EXAMPLE: These four types are the same as types 1–4, except that theft is committed with a neutral feeling.
EXAMPLE: These four types are the same as types 1–4, except that theft is committed with a neutral feeling.

INCLUDED IN A COMBINATION WITH 19 CHETASIKAS: 

 UNIVERSAL: 
 >> 1. Contact (Phassa) 
 >> 2. Feeling (Vedanā) 
 >> 3. Perception (Saññā) 
 >> 4. Volition (Cetana) 
 >> 5. One-pointedness (Ekaggatā) 
 >> 6. Management life-ability (Jīvitindriya) 
 >> 7. Attention (Manasikāra) 

 HAPPENING FROM TIME TO TIME: 
 >> 8. Starter application (Vitakka) 
 >> 9. Sustainable application (Vicāra) 
 >> 10. Determination (Adhimokkha) 
 >> 11. Energy (Viriya) 
 >> 12. Enthusiasm (Pīti) 
 >> 13. Desire to act (Chanda) 

 UNIVERSAL UNBENEFITABLE: 
 >> 14. Misconception (Moha) 
 >> 15. Shamelessness (Ahirika) 
 >> 16. Fearlessness of evil deeds (Anottappa) 
 >> 17. Anxiety (Uddhacca) 

 ADVERSE THINGS THAT HAPPEN FROM TIME TO TIME: 
 >> 18. Greed (Lobha) 
 >> 19. Erroneous view (Diṭṭhi)

8 types of consciousness rooted in greed

2 
 One consciousness, accompanied by joy, associated cited with an erroneous view, arising with motivation. 
 
 Somanassasahagatam dithigatasampayuttam sasankharikam ekam.

3 
 One consciousness, accompanied by joy, dissociated from the erroneous view, without prompting. 
 
 Somanassahagatam dithigatavippayuttam asankharikam ekam.

4 
 One consciousness, accompanied by joy, dissociated from wrong view, with motivation. 
 
 Somanassahagatam dithigatavippayuttam sasankhārikam ekam.

5 
 One consciousness, accompanied by calmness, associated with erroneous view, without motivation. 
 
 Upekkhāsahagatam dithigatasampayuttam asankharikam ekam.

6 
 One consciousness, accompanied by calmness, associated with an erroneous view, with an impulse. 
 
 Upekkhāsahagatam dithigatasampayuttam sasankhārikam ekam.

7 
 One consciousness, accompanied by calmness, dissociated from erroneous view, without prompting. 
 
 Upekkhāsahagatam ditthigatavippayuttam asankharikam ekam.

8 
One consciousness, accompanied by calm, dissociated from erroneous view, with motivation. 
 
 Upekkhāsahagatam dithigatavippayuttam sasankhārikam ekanti.
